title: Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Blumont (Ḩawwārah, Amman Governorate)
Interview Descriptions:
First interview typical interview questions. 
But when I asked about any training opportunities, I got faced with a No, that will be up to the project and the project has no budget for that. 

I asked again about career development, I got faced again with a No, the project is responsible for career development, but the project has a fixed structure and fixed rules. 
I can't move in my career if all the positions are already filled. 

I got asked for a 2nd interview, I declined
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join Blumont?

title: Communications Associate Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Blumont
Interview Descriptions:
Initially did a call screening with a recruiter from HR after applying online. Was then scheduled for an interview several days later.

The interview was structured as two separate interviews––each with 2 supervisors––conducted back to back. The interviews were immediately followed by a 2 hour writing test. So in all, the process took about 3.5 hours.

After a few weeks of waiting, I was declined for the role and told someone with more direct experience in the development field was chosen over me despite the fact that the recruiter told me it wouldn’t be an issue in the initial phone screening.

title: Talent Acquisition Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Blumont (Arlington, VA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: Really great to work with the team. Had an initial phone screening and then a more formal process ensued.  This included meeting with several future internal clients, as well as speaking with everyone on the team that I would go on to join.
Interview Questions: Experience in the world of ID

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Blumont (Arlington, VA) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: It has very well set it up. It started with a phone interview then followed up with an in-person interview.  I met the hiring manager and managing partner after. They asked me personal questions
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in 5 years?
Why do you want to work here?
Can you use R, SQL ?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Blumont (Washington, DC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: I first got an email about my application. I applied almost a month prior so I almost forgot that I even applied. The whole thing was relatively relaxed and standard.
Interview Questions: Very standard questions--things you would typically expect.

title: Finance Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Blumont (Arlington, VA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I would say that 0verall process was smooth. It was easy to find the place. There was a standard set of questions and the testing. HR Manager was very helpful and well coordinating the process of hiring. The time was convenient for me. The person who was supposed to interview me came on time. She held a small talk to make me feel relaxed. The general atmosphere was pleasant.
Interview Questions: all the questions were standard. Nothing special I was asked.

title: Logistics and Procurement Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Blumont (Herat) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: the interview processed remotely via internet using SKYPE application. several managers were interviewing and asking expertise and technical question regarding duties and responsibilities as a logistics and procurement assistant, and they showed interest about my logistical and inventory skills . they asked me about previous and employer and the duties i performed.
Interview Questions: Describing Cycle of procurement, Inventory and Supply Chain, bidding and soliciting, vendor list, preparing quotation,

title: Associate Program Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Blumont (Rosslyn, VA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to apply by a current employ that I new from previous work. After my initial application IRD waited six weeks to contact me. The sector Director that I work under interviewed me along with a future colleague. They both had read my resume, but they were clear what they were looking for. I would recommend coming into an interview ready to answer random technical questions but also ready to guide your interviewer.
Interview Questions: Technical questions about small grants programs
